messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] samurai battle formations
messages.msgSnippet: ... If you speak Japanese, have a look at Nihon SenJin SaHou JiTen $BF|K @o?X:nK!;vE5(B by Sasama Yoshihiko $B:{4VNII (B. It has a small section on
messages.messageBody:
On Wed, 08 Sep 2004 16:39:21 -0000, depos42300さん wrote:
>Hello,
> Does anyone know where i can get info. and pics about samurai
>battle formations? I'd like to know what it looked like and what
>kind of troop types were used and where. Thanks.
>
If you speak Japanese, have a look at "Nihon SenJin SaHou JiTen"
日本戦陣作法事典 by Sasama Yoshihiko 笹間良彦.

It has a small section on formations, but it's very imformative.

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] samurai battle formations
messages.msgSnippet: ... http://www.rit.edu/~mlc8826/training%20dojo/army%20tactics/armytact3.html The website takes it from Turnbull s books. It s some kind of gaming site, maybe
messages.messageBody:
--- depos42300 <depos42300@...> wrote:

> Hello,
> Does anyone know where i can get info. and pics
> about samurai
> battle formations? I'd like to know what it looked
> like and what
> kind of troop types were used and where. Thanks.

http://www.rit.edu/~mlc8826/training%20dojo/army%20tactics/armytact3.html

The website takes it from Turnbull's books. It's some
kind of gaming site, maybe STW--but at least it shows
you the pictures. Turnbull's "Samurai Sourcebook"
gives the legend for the pictures, as to what kind of
units they are.


http://www.double-bit-blade.com/ebay/swords/library/swordtour/samuraiwar/tactics.html


Here's a list, no pictures. I skimmed it, didn't read
it all, but it seems okay--though the sword advertised
at the bottom gives me reason for pause. If they can
advertise that monstrosity, I hope it's for the ad
money, and not an indicator of the website creator's
knowledge. Cripes.

http://www.page.sannet.ne.jp/m-sky/game/jw/zinkei.html

Here's an excellent site, in Japanese.

messages.subject: samurai battle formations

messages.messageBody:
Hello,
Does anyone know where i can get info. and pics about samurai
battle formations? I'd like to know what it looked like and what
kind of troop types were used and where. Thanks.
